column1: Butazolidin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).

Arms and legs: - Swelling of lower legs, ankles, or feet Bladder and kidneys: - Blood in urine - Decreased amount of urine - Kidney failure, absence of urine Eyes, ears, nose, and throat: - Blurred vision - Ringing in the ears Heart and blood vessels: - Low blood pressure Nervous system: - Agitation - Coma - Confusion - Convulsions - Dizziness - Drowsiness - Incoherence (not understandable) - Severe headache - Unsteadiness Skin: - Blisters - Rash Stomach and intestines: - Diarrhea - Heartburn - Nausea and vomiting (possibly with blood) - Stomach pain

Determine the following information: - Patient's age, weight, and condition - The name of the product (ingredients and strengths, if known) - When it was swallowed - The amount swallowed - If the medication was prescribed for the patient
